item.title: Report X-2024041355
item.description:
Report X-2024041355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: John Houle, 151 Operation Supervisor, advised Safety of a UN1133, Adhesives, 3, PG II spill on the trailer floor. John stated Curtis Baker was unloading the trailer when a box fell off the pallet causing the spill. Safety advised John that Cura will be called for remediation. Safety reviewed the pho tos showing the LTD QTY labels on the pallet behind the spill and called John back to confirm what spilled in the trailer before contacting CURA. John confirmed it was UN1133.

item.title: Report X-2024041213
item.description:
Report X-2024041213

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: ALISO VIEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN A SPILL TRAY INSIDE THE DMP CAGE. RESPONDER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING DUE TO A STAIN ON THE SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. ONCE PACKAGE WAS OPENED FOUND ONE CONTAINER OUT OF 2 BROKEN. RESPONDER PROCEEDED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP AND USED A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM TO RETURN THE UNDAMAGED PRODUCT.

item.title: Report E-2024040591
item.description:
Report E-2024040591

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Small Engine Fuels 50:1 2-Cycle Fuel (gasoline) (UN1203) released from (6) 2.5-gallon metal containers due to improper loading (it was triple stacked and fell during transit). The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The waste was placed into (4) 5 Gal DM of product and absorbents and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

Report X-2024041269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging was torn on one side and the closure flap was open. Liquid staining can be spotted around the box but has dried up already and the discoloration has already begun. Inside are 4 inner packages made of 1-gallon plastic container containing Lustra's Low pH Presoak 205 with product code UF205. 2 of these containers were wet just below where the cap rests. 3 of the bottles have stains in their labels. The approximate amount of the spill is about 8 fluid ounces.

item.title: Report X-2024041165
item.description:
Report X-2024041165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND A DAMAGED PACKAGE IN DMP AREA. PACKAGE SPECS: 24X16X24, ECT 32 LBS/IN. PACKAGE HAS NO MARKING OR LABEL TO IDENTIFY AS HAZARDOUS. INSIDE WERE (ACCORDING TO PACKING SLIP) 110 SODASTREAM CYLINDERS, THESE CYLINDERS ARE ONLY TO BE TRANSPORTED IN A SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED CONTAINER WITH DOT-SP. SHIPPING LABEL WAS CUT FROM ONE OF THE SODASTREAM BOX USED FOR RETURNING EMPLY CYLINDERS AND ATTACHED ON BOX. SODASTREAM CYLINDERS/CONTAINER WERE COLLECTED AND PREPARED FOR UNDELARED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS REPORT.
